column10: Good gameplay, lots of maps and options for variation, and watching Kylted play this convinced me to start playing.

fun

The interface is way too busy and not intuitive.  Too much to do before you even get to play a game.  I hated it after just 1 minute, yes that is true and I've never experience such quick hatred for a game in my long PC gaming history since first playing games on a Commodore 64.  DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

Note:  Three hours game play indicated includes playing the free version years ago.  I don't remember the interface being awful back then but boy do I hate it in the premium version I just tried for a few minutes.  Fastest refund I've ever requested.

Random mix is too unbalanced i see way too many things like 8vs8 = 5/0. game is like slot machine unless you play balanced. also random mix can literally give players almost full territories at 1-st turn in 6 player game. balance just isn't there at all, it's more like who gets lucky start wins. I just don't get it why not make it balanced random mix start and have some limitations to random dice roll. And placing troops at begging of game is just a 10+ minutes waste of time.

Great game, but tons of cheating. That's the big problem - great to play against the computer or friends. But if you play multiplayer games with 3 or more players you can bet somebody is actually controlling two other players and will win. 

So if they could stop the cheating it would be great, but as it is not a big fan
Portals are the best way to play.
v

Risk: Global Domination feels just like the real deal. I would know because I have played the board games! The game works exactly as the bord games do, but with cool new game rules that can spice up your sessions (if you so desire). My only complaint is that you can't make your own custom maps (which would have been amazing!). If they made a DLC for map creation I would easily buy it.

I really appreciate that they have invested in making this game fun and VERY re-playable for solo players, as I rarely have the time or energy for competitive multiplayer games.  The different rules/modes, maps, etc. (assuming you pay for the premium game + DLCs) makes it easy to have a new experience solo game whenever I have a little break. Please keep coming out with more maps!!!
can we get a no bot marker for multiplayer in the filter menu?

Game has been extremely laggy and kicking me off the server. And in some games in cloud mode, other players seem to know the board like they are cheating. Getting very disappointed with this game especially with the time and money invested into it. I will give a chance for a little while and see if that changes.

Plus, it doesn't let you choose the difficulty level you want to play. It chooses the difficulty automatically for you based on how good the game thinks you are.
I really enjoy playing this game and watching 'The Kill Pete Strategy' on YouTube

I first started to play Risk in the summer of 1969.  It's a great game.  For me, it was a chance to go back time I played Risk, and relive my misbegotten youth.  :)

+: Easy interface and captures most of the fun of the board game. Variety of content, I bought the bundle on sale so there is hours upon hours of stuff to try if I get board (sic) of fixed classic. 

-: Limited interaction, mutable voice chat or text chat would be nice for those rare times I actually want to be sociable.
very good, but expert AI makes mistakes occasionally allowing a defeated player to come back
Great game!  A lot of nostalgia from playing the board game with friends and fam!
Great game

Yeah, but its got a serious sore winner problem... to many times 2nd place has to deal with the ego of a winner that wants to gloat for 7 more turns. Plus, blitz dice seem to mostly favor the attacker... may be statistically inaccurate... but it sure feels that way.

This game is fun, but don't waste your time on the worthless one vs. all map that is completely luck dependent and requires multiple restarts. A game that penalizes you for things outside of your control is not my idea of good game design.

Don't spend money on this developer or time in their games. They use micro transactions and a digital coin based system to charge to play per game once you've downloaded. This should be considered fraud.

I've played this game 93 hours for researching purpose. I will make it short.

1- No chat!
- Sometimes I just want to tell the host to make the game for 4 players. They start it with 4 and make it 6. This is just 1 use case. Improve your filter and open the chat. If a kid is able to play this game then he can read internet. You are not the parent.

2- dice
- Unbalanced like hell

3- Ranked system is based on winning. 
That's causing a lot of cheap tactics. Rank should be on game style and decisions. if 5th strongest player attacking 6th strongest it should lower the rating.

4-Stupid Bots 
They are just attacking random low enemy grounds. Don't keep soldiers for smarter attack or any kind of strategy. Just avoid them and it will cause problem for enemy players while you are safe.

5- Abusive players
Players can come up with not smart but annoying strategies. One player starts to keep his soldiers in same place for 10 rounds. Others have to do same otherwise this guy will become stronger. So for 20 rounds everybody just gathering their strength. Solution might be something like this: If player has more than 5 x (owned zone) and doesn't lose %10 if his army start a rebellion on random location like it happens with zombie apocalypse.

Stop bringing up more visuals and make it fun to play.
Love the game from a kid.  Worth the 10 bucks!
Great little 5-10 min game
funnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn

WARNING: THIS GAME WILL REMOVE MAPS THAT YOU BOUGHT WITHOUT WARNING. I paid for map packs which contained Moscow and Russia maps and seemingly overnight the maps disappeared without a trace. This is likely Hasbro or SMG Studio trying to do some sort of performative "activism" to protest the war in Ukraine, when in reality deleting maps does absolutely NOTHING to stop the war, but DOES cheat their customers out of the hard earned money they spent. I STILL HAVE NOT BEEN REIMBURSED.

I really liked this game because it's addictive and fun, but I cannot in good faith recommend that anyone buy any additional content from this game besides playing the maps that are free, because according to the standard set, you could easily loose maps you have purchased in the blink of an eye.

I will not be purchasing any more content from this game until the developers reimburse me/ reinstate the maps, and then prove that this will not happen again.
Requires you to pay for multiplayer unless you buy the premium stuff. Refunded.

6 Apr 2022 edit:

This is a fun strategy game with a variety of options to keep things fresh, e.g. blizzards and the occasional new map pack, multiple game modes, solo/local/online, etc. A lot of purely cosmetic "money sinks" in the proprietary "gem" currency -based store (about which I have my own hang-ups), but to each their own. I'll save my funds for meaningful additions to gameplay, and pay directly in USD.

Today's Steam transaction (Dino map pack, first-day) proceeded seamlessly and instantly for the first time since DLC was originally removed and subsequently returned to the Steam platform. Glad to see it fully integrated again, at least for maps. Thanks.

It's just Risk. If you've mastered the classic board game, the new maps and AIs don't add anything new. Diverting, but not challenging. 

What if the European maps could give us a little history? What about lore for the original maps? The zombie map where attackers win a tie is a half-a-step in the right direction.

It's just an adaptation with cranked-out extras and absolutely nothing new. It's no Risk II is what I'm saying.

Since I have the Premium Mode, I don't worry about tokens.  If you end up enjoying the game, you will want to pick that up.  Overall, this is a great port of a classic tabletop game.  There's a sizable group of players out there to always play.  I don't have anything negative to say about the game.  They modified the token system and it should work fine for casual players like my son.  He hasn't run out of tokens yet but is considering DLC to support the game.

The game is fun, I've played many games and it offers variety for a game that is usually pretty much the "same" every game. 

The only thing I hate about this game is AI. AI takes very stupid decisions and unpredictable decisions. For example, in a manual setting, every AI tries to get a continent while choosing the territories. There is ALWAYS an AI playyer that is very well setup for, say, Australia and has a decent positioning for Russia, but when the time comes, will put all his troops on the same territory to attack the player (me) in, say north america without even taking some troops to secure Australia. This happens in EVERY single player games I played. This is happening on expert level. A player doing moves like that would loose just for doing that. So if you plan on playing this game for the single player, don't bother buying it, it's very disappointing...

Up until "Risk: Global Domination" came out I really only liked the Lux, Sega, and Factions video game adaptations of the board game. It's a matter of taste, but I'd say this new mammer jammer stands toe to toe with all three of those versions. Bang!
